text: EXAMINATION
Sir, could you state your name for the record?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Jose Eduardo Guerrero.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Mr. Guerrero, my name is Daniel Linn, and I'm the attorney for Maya Nelson in this action she's brought against you in connection with a car accident that took place on October 31st, 2017.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: We have an interpreter here today, correct?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I understand that you speak some English?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: 95 percent.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: For purposes of today, it's my understanding that you feel more comfortable testifying in Spanish, correct?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: That's correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So for purposes of today, I want you to make sure that you let the interpreter completely interpret my question before you begin to answer.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I never want us to be in a situation where you later told us that you didn't understand our questions.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: That's fine.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So I'm going to take your deposition today.  Have you ever had your deposition taken before?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Basically what this is is a question-and-answer session. I'm going to ask you some questions concerning your background.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Mhmm.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The accident, and some other matters.  If at any time I ask you a question that you don't know the answer to, please let me know that you do not understand my question and I will repeat it or rephrase it.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If you don't know the answer to a question, that's perfectly fine, just let me know and we'll move on.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: That's fine.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I may ask you for estimates in terms of time or distance.  If you can provide us with an estimate, please do so.  But if you simply have no idea, just let me know and I'll move on.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It's important today that you answer all questions verbally.  A shrug or a gesture does not show up on our transcript.  And sir, if I ask you a question today and you did not tell me that you were confused or you did not understand the question, I'm going to assume that you understood the question that I asked you and that you answered that question honestly.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: That's fine.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Sir, are you under the influence of any drugs, medication, or alcohol that would prevent your ability to understand and answer questions here today?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Sir, where do you currently reside?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Claymont, Delaware.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What's the address there?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: 13 Virginia Avenue, Claymont, Delaware 19703.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long have you resided at that address?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Since 2006 to now.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where were you born?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Mexico.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When did you come to this country?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Okay.  At some point, did you obtain U.S. citizenship?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When was that?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Okay.  Are you currently employed?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Who do you work for?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Benner & Sons.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The interpreter would like to let you know that the name is in English and he is pronouncing it in English.
speaker: THE INTERPRETER

text: That's fine.  And we've written down on a piece of paper B-E-N-N-E-R & Son.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: And you do painting for them?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long have you done that?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Close to 20 years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Back on October 31st, 2017, did you own a vehicle?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What type of vehicle did you own?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: 2007 Kia Rio.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you own that vehicle yourself or did anybody else own that vehicle with you?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Only myself.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was that vehicle in good working order at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did it have any mechanical problems of any kind?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Do you recall this accident happening on October 31st, 2017?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What time did the accident occur?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I don't remember, around...
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it the beginning of the day, the middle of the day, the end of the day?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: In the afternoon.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where were you going at the time?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: To pick up my wife.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you doing anything for your job at Benner & Sons at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So you were going to go pick up your son?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: To my wife.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Oh, your wife.  Where were you going, where was your wife, where were you going to pick her up?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: To McDonalds in Eddystone.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At a McDonalds in Eddystone?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have to be there by any particular time?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What time did you have to be there?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Why did you have to be there by 4:00?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Because that's the time that she comes out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did she work at McDonalds?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And she is done at 4:00?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you work that day?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What time did work begin and what time did it end?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I begin at 7:00 and I was finished at 3:30, well, I finished at 3:30.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And is it customary for you to pick your wife up from work at McDonalds?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And that would be 4:00 every day?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: It varies.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Why did you know on this day it was 4:00?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, it wasn't at 4:00, she came out at 4:00.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: She was done her work day at 4:00?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you knew that before you began your trip that day?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  I take it you don't like to be late when you go to pick up your wife?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Object to the form.
speaker: MS. KRENICKY

text: You can answer.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No, you do not like to be late?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is it a correct statement, yes or no, that you do not like to be late to pick up your wife?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I don't like arriving late.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Understood, thank you.  On the date of the accident, did you have a cellphone?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is it the same cellphone that you have today?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is it the same service that you have today?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is the service that you had with your cellphone back on October 31st, 2017?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Metro PCS.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And currently you're still with Metro PCS?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is the phone number the same?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes, it's the same.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was your phone number back on October 31st, 2017 with Metro PCS?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Okay.  What were the weather conditions like that day?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Clean, calm.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Clear and dry?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Where did the accident take place?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I don't know the name of the street.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Had you ever been through this intersection prior to the accident?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes, I use it every day.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what street you were driving on itself?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I don't know the name, but I know the street.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  You're familiar with the street, you just don't know the name?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you drive on this particular street at this intersection on a daily basis?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I'm still using it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You still use that street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you still go through that intersection on a daily basis?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  If the police report, sir, in this matter indicates that the incident took place at the intersection of 12th and Potter streets, would you have reason to disagree with that?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, that's probably right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  The police report indicates that prior to the accident, you had been traveling eastbound on 12th Street; does that sound right to you?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Just before you continue, I just want a standing objection to the use of the police report to any extent that it could be used into trial. But I understand what you're doing at this point.  So just so I don't keep interrupting you, I'd just like a standing objection to the admissibility of the police report in this case.
speaker: MS. KRENICKY

text: All right, no problem.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Sir, since we've agreed that you were traveling on 12th Street at the time of this accident, do you know how many blocks you had been traveling on 12th Street before the intersection where the accident took place?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I passed one and I was on the second, on the second.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you had driven approximately two blocks on 12th Street before the accident took place?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: 12th Street for the direction that you were traveling, how many lanes is it for your direction?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: There's two.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is it one lane in each direction?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: One lane going eastbound, one lane going westbound?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there parking on 12th Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yeah, on the street there are vehicles, on the right side, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there parking on both the east side of the street and the west side of the street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Is the intersection of 12th and Potter where this accident took place controlled by any traffic signs, lights, or devices?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: There was a light only.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is the light at 12th and Potter streets?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, it's further ahead.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So for the intersection at 12th and Potter, are there any traffic control devices, lights, or anything of that kind?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Only the stops.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there a stop sign for eastbound 12th Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yeah, there is three stops.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So for your direction of travel for eastbound 12th Street, there would have been a stop sign at its intersection at Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How about for cars traveling on Potter Street, are there any stop signs for cars traveling on Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: It also has a stop.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Was there any construction going on at the intersection of 12th and Potter Street on the date of this accident?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Not back then.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Are you familiar with Potter Street where it crosses at 12th Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes, I know the crossing, but I've never gone into that street.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Does Potter Street continue straight through 12th Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, it finishes there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  If a car was traveling on Potter Street as it approached 12th Street, could it continue straight or would it have to make either a left or a right?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, it can only turn either right or left.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And is that the case to the present time?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yeah, it's the same.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And do you recall seeing any construction vehicles of any kind at the intersection of 12th and Potter on the date of the accident?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What were traffic conditions like that day?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Not a lot of traffic.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Sir, from the time that you got onto 12th Street approximately two blocks before Potter Street, can you take me from that point in time and tell me what happened?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I still had like about ten meters to arrive to the stop sign, and when I looked at her car, she was already very close to the corner, to my corner.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Tell me what happened at that point.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I couldn't brake -- I did brake, but...
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What happened after you applied your brakes?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I stood there because we were already together.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Let's bring us back in time.  Do you know what street you were on just before you got onto 12th Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I think it was 322, I believe.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Is the intersection of 322 and 12th Street approximately two blocks away from Potter?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So you turn off of 322 and you get onto 12th Street, correct?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then you traveled one block?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is the intersection after that one block?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Is that intersection a block before Potter Street controlled by a traffic light or a stop sign?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: A stop sign.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you stop at that intersection one block before 12th and Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then the next intersecting street after that stop sign would be 12th and Potter?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what the speed limit would be on 12th Street as you're approaching Potter?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Okay.  If the police report in this matter indicated that the speed limit for 12th Street would have been 15 miles an hour, would you have a reason to agree or disagree with that?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, must be correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm sorry.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: It must be correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So if you were doing 25 miles an hour and the speed limit was 15 miles an hour, can we agree that you were traveling faster than the speed limit permitted as you were traveling on Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Objection to form.
speaker: MS. KRENICKY

text: You can answer.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I said 25 because I'm not sure.  I know that the speed limit is very slow.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay, fine.  As you were approaching Potter Street while proceeding down 12th, at any time were you utilizing your cellphone?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you making any calls?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I made calls after the accident.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you making calls just before the accident?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does your Kia that you had on the date of the accident, does that have hands-free use of your cellphone?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.  All my vehicles have that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have to hold your phone in order to make a phone call?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you texting at the time of this accident?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does your Kia Rio have the capability of hands-free texting while you're operating your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you would actually physically have to text on your phone in order to text if you were in your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.  But I wasn't doing that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Understood.  As you approach Potter Street, is there any obstruction to your view for cars that are traveling on Potter Street which approach 12th Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And by that I mean construction?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Shrubbery or trees?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So as you're coming down 12th Street, at any point in time, do you stop at the stop sign before the impact?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, because I hadn't gotten to the stop yet.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  At the moment of impact, approximately how fast were you traveling?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I was almost stopped.  Like 5 or 10, something like that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  When you first see the other vehicle for the very first time, where is that vehicle?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: She was coming out of her stop from the street.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was she coming out from Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you first see her for the first time you say she's coming out, has she entered the intersection yet?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: She had already come out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How much of her vehicle had entered the intersection at the time that you first see her?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: She had already come into the street.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was half of her car into the intersection, her entire car into the intersection, a small portion, can you give us an estimate as to how much of her car was into the intersection when you first lay eyes on it?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Half of the vehicle.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So half of the vehicle was still on Potter Street and half of her vehicle was into the intersection; is that correct?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: When you first saw it.
speaker: MS. KRENICKY

text: When you first saw it.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yeah.  The first time that I saw it, it was half inside.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Where is the front of your vehicle when you see her vehicle for the very first time?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I was arriving to the stop.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Can you give us an estimate as to how far you were from the stop sign when you first saw her vehicle for the first time?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Like five meters.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And at that point, your vehicle was traveling five miles an hour?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yeah, because I was getting ready for the stop.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  At the moment of impact, can you tell us where your vehicle was?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Behind the stop.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Were you still five meters from the stop sign at the moment of impact?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.  What happens is that she came out very fast and she went into my lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay, and I understand that. I guess what I want to know is at the moment of impact, how far from the stop sign were you?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Like three meters.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you said that when she made her turn, she was in your lane of travel, correct?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: The interpreter needs repetition.
speaker: THE INTERPRETER

text: At the moment of impact, she was in your lane of travel?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Not all of it, but half of it, a part of it, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And we can agree that you were in the eastbound lanes of 12th Street, correct?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How much of her vehicle was in the eastbound lanes at the moment of impact?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: The street is small, like a meter.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Was any portion of her vehicle in the westbound lane of 12th Street at the moment of impact?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How much of her vehicle was in the westbound lane versus how much of her vehicle was in the eastbound lane?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: She only went like a meter inside of my lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And the impact took place approximately three meters before the stop sign on 12th Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: From the time that you first see her when you were five meters from the stop sign until the moment of impact, can you give us an estimate as to how much time passed?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: How much time went by?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: From the moment that you first see her until the moment of impact, how much time passed?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Seconds.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you do anything to try and attempt to avoid the accident?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes, I applied the brakes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you blow your horn?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I didn't have time for that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the other driver blow her horn?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yeah, when we had already crashed she did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did she blow her horn before the impact?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, I never heard it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But she blew her horn after the impact?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yeah, already when we had already touched.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have any explanation as to why she would have blown her horn after impact?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what the speed of her vehicle was at the moment of impact?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: I can only say that she came out of the stop very fast, that's the only thing that I think.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you ever see any part of her vehicle traveling up Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where was she on Potter Street when you saw her traveling up Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Well, I just saw her when she came out of the stop.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Did you ever see her vehicle before it entered the intersection of Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was there anything that would have obstructed your view from seeing her traveling down Potter Street before it got to the intersection?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you were five meters from the stop sign, approximately how far down Potter Street can you see the vehicle?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Inside of the street, very little.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Why is it that you can only see very little?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Because there are cars parked on that street.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Were cars parked on Potter Street as it approached its intersection on that particular day?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And those parked vehicles was what would have obstructed your view of seeing her car come up Potter Street as it approached 12th?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Not me, but I guess the other vehicle would have had problems because they're parked on the other side.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So when you say, "Not me," was your view of vehicles coming up Potter Street obstructed?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you had a clear view of cars coming up Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Could you see half a block down Potter Street where it meets its intersection with 12th Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yeah.  You can see when the cars are coming up to do the stop.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: From five meters from the stop sign, could you see half a block down Potter Street as it approaches its intersection with 12th Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Half the block, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How much of the block can you see when you're five meters from the stop sign?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Like ten meters.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  As you were five meters from the stop sign, did you look down Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.

text: And at that point, you could see ten meters down Potter Street?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: More or less.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What part of your vehicle was struck?

text: The driver side.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Would that be the front of your car?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: No, it wasn't in front, it was in the corner of the bumper.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that where the front of your car meets the side of your car?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: The interpreter needs repetition, I'm sorry.
speaker: THE INTERPRETER

text: Would that be where the front of your car meets the driver side of your car?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Off the record.
speaker: MR. LINN

text: (Whereupon, a brief discussion was held off the record.)
Can you tell me what portion of my client's vehicle made contact with your vehicle?

text: The driver's door.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Her driver's door?
speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.

text: No.

text: Yes.

text: Yes.

text: No.

text: Sir, I want to show you some photographs from Google Maps, okay? First off, I'm going to show you a packet of photos and I'm going to ask you to look through those photos and my question will be do you recognize what's shown in these photographs.

text: Keep looking.

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. LINN

text: Yes.

text: Okay.

Sir, I'm showing you what we marked as D-2.  Does this show your view that you would have had as you approached Potter Street on that day?

text: Yes.

text: With an X, sir, I'm going to give you my pen, and I'd like you to place on this photograph, if you can, an X where the front of your car was when you first laid eyes on the other vehicle. Okay.  Can you circle that for me, sir?

text: Yes.
